QAPair.Question: What is (are) Diabetes - resources ?
QAPair.Answer: The following sites provide further information on diabetes : American Diabetes Association -- www.diabetes.org , Centers for Disease Control and Prevention -- www.cdc.gov/diabetes/index.html , Endocrine Society, Hormone Health Network -- www.endocrine.org/patient-engagement/endocrine-library/diabetes-and-endocrine-function , Juvenile Diabetes Research Foundation International -- www.jdrf.org , National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases -- www.niddk.nih.gov/health-information/diabetes , National Library of Medicine, MedlinePlus -- medlineplus.gov/diabetes.html , Association of Diabetes Care & Education Specialists (ADCES) -- www.diabeteseducator.org/ , The following organizations have information on diabetes-related complications. Diabetic retinopathy resources: National Eye Institute -- www.nei.nih.gov/learn-about-eye-health/eye-conditions-and-diseases/diabetic-retinopathy , American Academy of Ophthalmology -- www.aao.org/eye-health/diseases/what-is-diabetic-retinopathy , Diabetic neuropathy (nerve pain) resources: American Chronic Pain Association -- www.acpanow.com , National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke -- www.ninds.nih.gov/health-information/disorders/diabetic-neuropathy , Kidney disease resources: National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases -- www.niddk.nih.gov/health-information/kidney-disease , National Kidney Foundation -- www.kidney.org/atoz/atozTopic_Diabetes ,
